feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 3:53AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snowfall Expected for the Eastern Interior and Alaska Range through Tuesday... A mix of rain and snow then changing to all snow for the Eastern Interior this morning. Not much accumulation expected for Fairbanks, but areas above 1000 feet could get up to 2 or 3 inches. Areas in the Alaska Range will likely get significant snow
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp; Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Fortymile Country; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Northern Denali Borough; Southern Denali Borough; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; Upper Tanana Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches along the Richardson Highway from Paxson north to Isabel Pass and 1 to 3 along the Glenn Highway and Tok Cutoff. North winds gusting to 40 mph north of Paxson Monday afternoon through
entry.cap:areaDesc: Copper River Basin

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued October 02 at 2:02AM AKDT until October 03 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and Blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 02 at 2:02AM AKDT until October 03 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 1:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and blowing snow in the Brooks Range into Monday... An arctic front moving through the Brooks Range will bring snow and blowing snow. 2 to 4 inches of snow is expected through Monday, along with northerly winds 15 to 30 mph which will reduce visibility. Use caution if traveling in the area.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Arctic Plains; Central Brooks Range

entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Coastal; Mobile Coastal

entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.summary: ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 25, if not lower, in some spots. * WHERE...Lower Yampa River Basin, Central Yampa River Basin, Upper Yampa River Basin and Central Colorado River Basin.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 9:52AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Fremont, central Custer and eastern Saguache Counties through 1030 AM MDT... At 951 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Canon City to near Crestone Peak. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 02 at 9:29AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Prior rainfall and weather conditions will keep the Saint Johns River at Astor in Moderate Flood Stage. River levels are forecast to remain at to just above Moderate Flood Stage of 3.0 feet at Astor through the week.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia
